Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2008 03:19PM Graceface wrote: Hi erin1: I had mine last month.  No stitches or steri strips,they use a surgical glue.You will have a scar.  My incision is about 2 inches long. Looks good 1 month later, I have been using Mederma, don't use Vitamin E,clinical study from U of Miami. I was in the operating room for about 45 minutes and in Recovery Room for 2 hours.  No pain, they gave me a RX for darvocet and I never got it filled.  I used Tylenol extra strength for about a day.  You can go back to work if you have to, I didn't.  I had to wear a bra for 24 hours and use ice off and on for one night.  No lifting of anything over 10 lbs for 10 days. Good Luck!

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 05:53PM Graceface wrote: My results were benign, ADH....they say puts you at higher risk. Referred to high risk breast clinic. I did not have a lump removed,I had tissue removed. My wire insertion was not as easy as they said it was going to be.  The tissue marker, which was inserted during a stereotactic bx migrated.....more than the average.  The wire that they insert is like a piece of picture wire, except thinner.  They numb your breast with lidocaine, feels like a bee sting, prior to the insertion.  My wire insertion was in radiology dept, prior to the excisional bx.  The wire insertion was awkward, after the wire is in, they taped it down and walked me back to OR holding area.  It wasn't painful, just mild discomfort.They also do a couple of mammograms to make sure the wire is in the right place.  The wire marks the spot where the surgeon will cut.  I'm sure you will be in good hands tomorrow!  God Bless!

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2008 02:43AM Graceface wrote: Same situation as you, excisional biopsy, no cancer, but ADH with other risk factors.  Referred to High Risk Breast Clinic to meet with medical oncologist.  I was referred there by my breast surgeon back in June and my appointment is not until October. If I am a candidate,I would decline, based on data, the benefits do not outweigh the risks for me.  I'm just being patient until my appt in Oct. Good Luck to you.
